movesets.name: Leadlass

items.name: Focus Sash
items.description: The holder always survives one attack. One-time use.

movesets.description:
Moves

Being able to use Spikes is Froslass's greatest niche in the metagame and can help wear down the opposing team over time. In order to do this efficiently, Froslass needs to use Taunt to prevent opposing Pokemon from using Defog or Taunt, setting up their own entry hazards, or setting up. Destiny Bond is also effective in tandem with Froslass's base 110 Speed and allows her to take down other Pokemon, especially Rapid Spin users, with her after Focus Sash is used up. Thunder Wave is preferred for the last move of the set because it allows her to shut down fast Pokemon trying to set up, such as Mega Houndoom, and paves the way for her own Taunt and Destiny Bond. Icy Wind is a STAB option that works similar to Thunder Wave and keeps Froslass from becoming complete Taunt bait. She can catch Taunt users coming in on a switch and then Taunt them to keep herself from being Taunted.

Set Details

The EVs are standard for a suicide lead with no attacking moves. If STAB Icy Wind or Shadow Ball is opted for over Thunder Wave, then the HP EVs can be moved over to Special Attack accordingly. Focus Sash guarantees that Froslass can survive to lay down at least one layer of Spikes. Timid is to maximize Speed for using Taunt and Destiny Bond. Cursed Body allows Froslass to set up an additional layer of Spikes against Choice-locked Pokemon roughly a third of the time.

Usage Tips

Froslass should be sent out towards, if not at, the beginning of the match to make the most out of Spikes. Don't bother with other moves unless absolutely necessary, especially when running STAB attacks. Use Destiny Bond to your advantage by playing mind tricks on your opponent and earning yourself an easy KO. You can even bluff Destiny Bond and use Spikes instead, racking up damage on the incoming switch. She's fairly useless late game, especially because Stealth Rock breaks Focus Sash, so try to send her out early. Keep in mind that Froslass, even at one HP, can still spinblock if necessary.

Team Options

Sweepers that can take advantage of Spikes, Taunt, and Thunder Wave make for the best partners, such as Choice Scarf Darmanitan or Sharpedo. Froslass fits easily onto hyper offensive teams in need of a suicide lead, especially ones with no space for a spinblocker.

movesets.name: Suicide Spiker

items.name: Focus Sash
items.description: The holder always survives one attack. One-time use.

movesets.description:
Moves

Taunt stops slower Pokemon from setting up boosts, laying entry hazards, or using Taunt themselves. Spikes is used to punish your opponent's switches and make life easier for your other Pokemon. Destiny Bond is a great move to take advantage of the fact that Froslass is a suicide lead and pairs well with Focus Sash. Ice Beam KOes common Stealth Rock leads like Garchomp and Landorus-T while also 2HKOing many common Defoggers.

Set Details

Special Attack and Speed are maximized because Froslass is a frail, fast suicide lead, and the Special Attack investment nets it some important KOs such as a 2HKO on Latias. Cursed Body is a good ability to potentially get extra chances to set up by disabling an opponent's priority or Choice-locked attacks. Focus Sash is necessary to give Froslass an extra turn to use Spikes or Destiny Bond.

Usage Tips

Froslass will almost always be your lead, unless the opponent has a Magic Bounce User such as Espeon or Mega Absol that renders it ineffective. If your opponent leads with something like Heatran or Gyarados that commonly sets up entry hazards or boosts, then it's best to use Taunt first. If instead they just have an all-out attacker, then start setting up Spikes. When Froslass is about to be KOed, a choice must be made. If you feel that you have enough layers of Spikes up and the attacking Pokemon is a threat to your team, then use Destiny Bond. If the Pokemon is not a threat, then an extra layer of Spikes may be more helpful. Be careful, as a savvy opponent might know about Destiny Bond, expect it, and not attack the second time. If your opponent leads with Talonflame with the goal of limiting you to one layer of Spikes by using Brave Bird, then Froslass should use Destiny Bond the first turn. They will be forced to either switch to save their Talonflame, or attack again and let it be KOed. By doing this, Froslass will either eliminate what is probably a large threat to your team or scare the Talonflame out and get hazards up.

Team Options

Bisharp or Defiant Thundurus can discourage Defog after Froslass goes down. Prankster Thundurus is good on offensive teams in general to stop sweepers with Thunder Wave or sweep with Nasty Plot. Belly Drum Azumarill is a potent sweeper that also enjoys having its checks weakened by entry hazards. Either Mega Evolution of Charizard can force switches and fit well on offensive teams. Offensive teams usually also want Stealth Rock, so Pokemon that can set it up, such as Terrakion, Garchomp, Landorus, or Landorus-T, are good. Really, any good offensive Pokemon will fit on a team with Froslass and be able to take advantage of the Spikes.

moves.name: Astonish
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Avalanche
moves.description: Doubles in power if damaged by the target.

moves.name: Bide
moves.description: Charges for 2-3 turns; returns double the damage received in those turns.

moves.name: Bite
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Blizzard
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Block
moves.description: The target cannot switch out.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confuse Ray
moves.description: Confuses the target.

moves.name: Crunch
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Destiny Bond
moves.description: If the user faints, the foe faints.

moves.name: Disable
moves.description: Prevents the last move used from being used again for 2-5 turns.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Dream Eater
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt. Only works if target is asleep.

moves.name: Embargo
moves.description: Item use is prevented for five turns.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fake Tears
moves.description: Lowers Special Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Flash
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy 1 stage.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Frost Breath
moves.description: Always results in a critical hit.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Hail
moves.description: Summons hail for 5 turns.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Hex
moves.description: Base Power doubles if target has a status ailment.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Ice Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.name: Ice Fang
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch. 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Ice Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.name: Ice Shard
moves.description: The user always attacks first.

moves.name: Icy Wind
moves.description: Lowers foe's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Leer
moves.description: Lowers target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Light Screen
moves.description: Lowers damage from special attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Ominous Wind
moves.description: 10% chance to boost all stats by 1 stage.

moves.name: Pain Split
moves.description: Averages both Pokemon's HP.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Powder Snow
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Psychic
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense 1 stage.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Rollout
moves.description: Doubles in power with each hit. Repeats for 5 turns.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Safeguard
moves.description: Blocks status conditions for 5 turns.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Shock Wave
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Signal Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Sing
moves.description: Puts the target to sleep.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snatch
moves.description: If certain moves are used, the user of Snatch uses the moves instead.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Spikes
moves.description: Causes damage to the enemy whenever they switch.

moves.name: Spite
moves.description: Lowers the PP of the move used last by 1-5.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sucker Punch
moves.description: The user always moves first. Will only work if the foe attacked.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Switcheroo
moves.description: Switches items with the target.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Telekinesis
moves.description: Lasts 3 turns and makes all moves hit the target.  Makes target immune to Ground-type moves.

moves.name: Thunder
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Thunder Wave
moves.description: Paralyzes the foe.

moves.name: Thunderbolt
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Trick
moves.description: Switches items with the foe.

moves.name: Wake-Up Slap
moves.description: Double Base Power if used on a sleeping foe.

moves.name: Water Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Weather Ball
moves.description: Doubles in power and changes type if there is weather.

abilities.name: Cursed Body
abilities.description: The wielder has a 30% chance to disable any move that hits it.
